sanskrit_verse:
वधेनापि यदा त्वेतान्निग्रहीतुं न शक्नुयात् ।
तदेषु सर्वमप्येतत्प्रयुञ्जीत चतुष्टयम् ॥ ८.१३०॥
transliteration: vadhenāpi yadā tvetānnigrahītuṃ na śaknuyāt | tadeṣu sarvamapyetatprayuñjīta catuṣṭayam || 8.130 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: When even execution fails to restrain these offenders, then all fourfold measures must be applied comprehensively.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority escalates proportionally with resistance to restoration
Causation is anchored in persistent violation despite prior interventions
Capacity-based responsibility expands with demonstrated defiance of Dharma
Restoration logic requires exhaustive application when lesser means fail
Consciousness alignment demands full spectrum response for unrepentant actors
executable_legal_axioms: IF restraint measure A fails AND offender continues violation THEN escalate to comprehensive fourfold enforcement
IF execution-level intervention proves ineffective THEN activate all remaining lawful capacities simultaneously
IF actor demonstrates persistent misalignment THEN jurisdiction must exhaust all dharmic protocols without omission
IF lower-order restoration fails THEN invoke complete suite of non-punitive realignment tools
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, when capital or maximum penalties prove insufficient to restore order, the court must authorize deployment of all four corrective limbs as prescribed—without exception—to ensure societal integrity and dharma-sthiti.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that sequential failure necessitates full activation; anupūrvaśaḥ confirms escalation path; proportional responsibility lies in exhausting restoration before assuming systemic failure; non-punitive reality rule holds that completion, not suffering, restores balance.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Sequential completion verification across all four limbs
Responsibility assumption by governing authority until alignment is restored
Integrity reintegration through witnessed completion cycles
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this directive executes as Dharma. Justice flows from consciousness, not coercion. Restoration prevails over punishment. The law stands realigned.
